decision_conditions:
The wording of the Conditions on the Decision Notice attached to planning permission P2019/2174/S73 dated 20th December 2019 should now read as:

1 CONDITION: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 

The following documents are approved by Planning Permission P2017/2936/FUL: Existing Plans AL(0)100; AL(0)101; AL(0)150; AL(0)151; AL(0)170; AL(0)180; AL(0)185; AL(0)190; Proposed Plans AL(0)200 P7; AL(0)201 P7; AL(0)202 P7; AL(0)203 P7; AL(0)204 P7; AL(0)205 P8; AL(0)206 P8; AL(0)210 P1; AL(0)211 P4; AL(0)212 P4; AL(0)213 P4; AL(0)214 P4; AL(0)221 P4; AL(0)222 P4; AL(0)223 P4; AL(0)224 P4; AL(0)231 P4; AL(0)232 P4; AL(0)233 P4; AL(0)234 P4; AL(0)241 P4; AL(0)242 P4; AL(0)243 P4; AL(0)244 P4; AL(0)251 P4; AL(0)252 P4; AL(0)253 P4; AL(0)254 P4; AL(0)255 P5; AL(0)256 P5; AL(0)260 P3; AL(0)261 P2; AL(0)270 P3; AL(0)271 P2; AL(0)280 P3; AL(0)281 P1; AL(0)282 P3; AL(0)283 P3; AL(0)284 P3; AL(0)290 P2; AL(0)291 P2; AL(0)292 P3; AL(0)293 P2; AL(0)300 P3; AL(0)301; AL(0)302; AL(0)303; AL(0)304; Planning Statement by HTA dated January 2018; Design & Access Statement (Rev A) by BFF dated December 2017; Statement of Community Involvement by HTA; Transport Statement and Travel Plan by Vectos dated January 2018; Flood Risk Assessment and Sustainable Drainage Statement by MLM; Arboricultural Survey and AIA by Sharon Hosegood Associates; Addendum AIA Report by SHA dated November 2017; Arboricultural Report by SHA dated November 2017; Extended Phase 1 Habitat Survey by DF Clark; Sustainable Design and Construction Statement Revision B dated November 2017; Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment by Ingleton Wood; Thermal Comfort Analysis by Ingleton Wood; Site Services Plan by Ingleton Wood; Air Quality Assessment by Bureau Veritas; Environmental Noise and Vibration Survey Assessment by AIRO; Daylight & Sunlight Report (Revised) dated December 2017 by Malcolm Hollis; Townscape Elevation by BFF; Drainage Statement by MLM dated November 2017; Facing Materials Palette uploaded 10th January 2018; Proposed Accommodation Schedule Revision C; Proposed Area Schedule Revision D; and Additional views uploaded 10th January 2018. 

The following additional documents are approved by Planning Permission P2019/2174/S73: 

AL(0)200 Rev P9; AL(0)201 Rev P9; AL(0)202 Rev P9; AL(0)203 Rev P9; AL(0)204 Rev P9; AL(0)205 Rev P10; AL(0)206 Rev P9; AL(0)211 Rev P6; AL(0)212 Rev P6; AL(0)213 Rev P6; AL(0)214 Rev P5; AL(0)221 Rev P5; AL(0)222 Rev P5; AL(0)223 Rev P5; AL(0)224 Rev P5; AL(0)231 Rev P6; AL(0)232 Rev P6; AL(0)233 Rev P6; AL(0)234 Rev P5; AL(0)241 Rev P6; AL(0)242 Rev P6; AL(0)243 Rev P6; AL(0)244 Rev P5; AL(0)251 Rev P5; AL(0)252 Rev P5; AL(0)253 Rev P5; AL(0)254 Rev P5; AL(0)255 Rev P5; AL(0)256 Rev P5; AL(0)260 Rev P5; AL(0)261 Rev P5; AL(0)270 Rev P5; AL(0)271 Rev P5;AL(0)280 Rev P5; AL(0)281 Rev P5; AL(0)282 Rev P5; AL(0)283 Rev P5; AL(0)284 Rev P5; AL(0)290 Rev P5; AL(0)291 Rev P5; AL(0)292 Rev P5; AL(0)293 Rev P5; AL(0)300 Rev P5; AL(0)303 Rev P5; AL(0)304 Rev P5; DCC-BFF-XX-XX-SCH-A01-5100_AMENITY AREA SCHEDULE; Cover Letter prepared by Burrell Foley Fischer (dated 15/08/2019); Report on Changes to Proposed Surface Water Drainage from the Planning Design prepared by CTP Consulting Engineers (ref: A5897/7/SM/NG); Arboricultural Method Statement Report and Site Supervision (ref: SHA 151 AMS Rev A, dated 09/08/2019); Daylight and Sunlight Report prepared by Hollis (ref: 49307/IM/DTO, dated 07/11/2019); Vehicle Tacking - Refuse Vehicle DCC-CTP-ZZ-XX-GAD01-050- Rev G; and Vehicle Tacking - Fire Appliance DCC-CTP-ZZ-XX-GA-D01-051- Rev B. 

REASON: To comply with Section 70(1)(a) of the Town and Country Act 1990 as amended and for the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
description: Non-material amendment to planning permission P2017/2936/FUL dated 19/03/2018, amended by P2029/2174/S73 dated 20/12/2019, for The Construction of 41 new dwelling units comprising 6 x 1B2P, 6 x 2B3P, 25 x 2B4P, 3 x 3B5P and 1 x 4B6P with associated amenity space, for affordable and private homes, provided in five residential mews blocks ranging from 1 to 4 storeys in height and one residential block of 6 stories in height, bicycle parking spaces and improvements to the public realm; the provision of 39sqm of space for community use; and the demolition of lock-up storage units and site management office, the demolition and relocation of the sub-station; and the conversion of two existing dwellings to bicycle, refuse and ancillary storage. The amendment being the replacement of cycle and bin stores at ground floor level of Dixon Clark Court with a TMO office and insertion of a new door and window, associated cycle store and recycling store, and external ramp.
